text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
HIVDTB 0..*BaseHIVD HIV-TB Logical Model
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
whoHivClinicalStageConditionOrSymptom 1..1stringWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom
pulmonaryTb 1..1stringPulmonary TB
lymphNodeTb 1..1stringLymph node TB
extrapulmonaryTb 1..1stringExtrapulmonary TB
tbDisease 1..1stringTB disease
tbDiagnosisResult 1..1stringTB diagnosis result
diagnosedTb 1..1stringDiagnosed TB
tbExcluded 1..1stringTB excluded
methodOfTbDiagnosis 1..1stringMethod of TB diagnosis
bacteriologicallyConfirmed 1..1stringBacteriologically confirmed
clinicallyDiagnosed 1..1stringClinically diagnosed
presumptiveTb 1..1stringPresumptive TB
presumptiveTbRegistrationDate 1..1stringPresumptive TB registration date
tbTreatmentHistory 1..1stringTB treatment history
new 1..1stringNew
recurrent 1..1stringRecurrent
reRegistered 1..1stringRe-registered
unknown 1..1stringUnknown
dateOfTbDiagnosis 1..1stringDate of TB diagnosis
currentlyOnTbPreventiveTreatmentTpt 1..1stringCurrently on TB preventive treatment (TPT)
tbPreventiveTreatmentTptStartDate 1..1stringTB preventive treatment (TPT) start date
tbPreventiveTreatmentTptCompletionDate 1..1stringTB preventive treatment (TPT) completion date
tbScreeningAlgorithm 1..1stringTB screening algorithm
screeningWithCough 1..1stringScreening with cough
screeningWithAnyTbSymptom 1..1stringScreening with any TB symptom
w4ssSingleScreeningAlgorithm 1..1stringW4SS single screening algorithm
crpSingleScreeningAlgorithm 1..1stringCRP single screening algorithm
cxrSingleScreeningAlgorithm 1..1stringCXR single screening algorithm
parallelScreeningAlgorithmWithW4SsAndCrp 1..1stringParallel screening algorithm with W4SS and CRP
sequentialPositiveScreeningAlgorithmWithW4SsAndCrp 1..1stringSequential positive screening algorithm with W4SS and CRP
sequentialNegativeScreeningAlgorithmWithW4SsAndCrp 1..1stringSequential negative screening algorithm with W4SS and CRP
parallelScreeningAlgorithmWithW4SsAndCxr 1..1stringParallel screening algorithm with W4SS and CXR
sequentialPositiveScreeningAlgorithmWithW4SsAndCxr 1..1stringSequential positive screening algorithm with W4SS and CXR
sequentialNegativeScreeningAlgorithmWithW4SsAndCxr 1..1stringSequential negative screening algorithm with W4SS and CXR
screeningWithMwrd 1..1stringScreening with mWRD
clinicalAssessment 1..1stringClinical assessment
otherTbScreeningAlgorithm 1..1stringOther TB screening algorithm
otherTbScreeningAlgorithmSpecify 1..1stringOther TB screening algorithm (specify)
tbScreeningConducted 1..1stringTB screening conducted
symptomsOfTb 1..1stringSymptoms of TB
currentCough 1..1stringCurrent cough
prolongedCoughGte2W 1..1stringProlonged cough (>=2w)
feverOf39COrGreater 1..1stringFever of 39 °C or greater
weightLossReported 1..1stringWeight loss (reported)
nightSweats 1..1stringNight sweats
poorWeightGain 1..1stringPoor weight gain
reducedPlayfulness 1..1stringReduced playfulness
chestPain 1..1stringChest pain
haemoptysis 1..1stringHaemoptysis
lethargy 1..1stringLethargy
none 1..1stringNone
historyOfContactWithAPersonWithTb 1..1stringHistory of contact with a person with TB
tbScreeningResult 1..1stringTB screening result
screenPositiveForTb 1..1stringScreen positive for TB
screenNegativeForTb 1..1stringScreen negative for TB
inconclusive 1..1stringInconclusive
tbScreeningDate 1..1stringTB screening date
tbScreeningResultDate 1..1stringTB screening result date
tbDiagnosticTestCategory 1..1stringTB diagnostic test category
lfLam 1..1stringLF-LAM
mwrdTestForTb 1..1stringmWRD test for TB
microscopySputumAcidFastBacilliAfb 1..1stringMicroscopy - Sputum acid-fast bacilli (AFB)
tbCulture 1..1stringTB Culture
tbDiagnosticTestDate 1..1stringTB diagnostic test date
testSampleCollectionDate 1..1stringTest sample collection date
tbDiagnosticTestResultDate 1..1stringTB diagnostic test result date
tbTreatmentStarted 1..1stringTB treatment started
tbTreatmentStartDate 1..1stringTB treatment start date
tbTreatmentOutcome 1..1stringTB treatment outcome
treatmentFailed 1..1stringTreatment failed
cured 1..1stringCured
treatmentCompleted 1..1stringTreatment completed
died 1..1stringDied
lostToFollowUp 1..1stringLost to follow-up
notEvaluated 1..1stringNot evaluated
tbTreatmentCompletionDate 1..1stringTB treatment completion date
tbTreatmentRegimenComposition 1..1stringTB treatment regimen composition
isoniazid 1..1stringIsoniazid
rifampicin 1..1stringRifampicin
rifabutin 1..1stringRifabutin
ethambutol 1..1stringEthambutol
levofloxacin 1..1stringLevofloxacin
pyrazinamide 1..1stringPyrazinamide
eligibleForTbPreventiveTreatment 1..1stringEligible for TB preventive treatment
dateWhenEligibilityForTbPreventiveTreatmentTptWasDetermined 1..1stringDate when eligibility for TB preventive treatment (TPT) was determined
tbStatusAtArtStart 1..1stringTB status at ART start
symptomaticForTb 1..1stringSymptomatic for TB
lcDiagnosedTb 1..1stringDiagnosed TB
lcNone 1..1stringNone
tbPreventionServicesAccepted 1..1stringTB prevention services accepted
tbMeningitis 1..1stringTB meningitis
cReactiveProteinTestDate 1..1stringC reactive protein test date
cReactiveProteinTestResult 1..1stringC reactive protein test result
cReactiveProteinTestResultDate 1..1stringC reactive protein test result date
tptRegimenType 1..1stringTPT regimen type
threeHp 1..1string3HP
oneHp 1..1string1HP
sixH 1..1string6H
sixMonthsOfLevofloxacinDaily 1..1stringSix months of levofloxacin daily
otherTbPreventiveTreatmentTptRegimen 1..1stringOther TB preventive treatment (TPT) regimen
tbPreventiveTreatmentTptStatus 1..1stringTB preventive treatment (TPT) status
notStarted 1..1stringNot started
onTpt 1..1stringOn TPT
onTptWithInterruptions 1..1stringOn TPT with interruptions
onHold 1..1stringOn hold
completed 1..1stringCompleted

Documentation for this format

name: HIVDTB
title: HIVD HIV-TB Logical Model
description: Logical Model for HIV.D HIV-TB data elements.

element.definition: Logical Model for HIV.D HIV-TB data elements.

element.short: WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom
element.definition: New or recurrent clinical events used to categorize HIV disease severity based at baseline and follow up
Clients symptoms include pulmonary TB
Clients symptoms include lymph node TB
Clients symptoms include extrapulmonary tuberculosis (TB)
Whether the client has tuberculosis (TB) disease. Sometimes known as active TB
Final result of the TB investigation (bacteriological and/or clinical)
Client is diagnosed with TB disease
Client is not diagnosed with TB
Method used to set the TB diagnosis
A person from whom a biological specimen is positive by smear microscopy, culture or a WHO-recommended rapid diagnostic

A person who does not fulfil the criteria for bacteriological confirmation but has been diagnosed with TB disease by a medical practitioner who has decided to give the person a full course of TB treatment
Client has signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) without laboratory confirmation
Date client is registered as having signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) without laboratory confirmation
History of previous TB treatment
A person with TB disease who has never been treated for TB before or has only previously ever taken TB drugs for less than 1 month

A person with TB disease who was previously treated for TB, was declared cured or treatment completed at the end of their most recent course of TB treatment and is now diagnosed with a new episode of TB.
A person with TB disease who had been notified previously as a TB case, but was not declared cured or treatment completed, and is now being registered for a new course of TB treatment.
A person with TB disease who has undocumented history of TB treatment
The date when the diagnosis was established
Client is currently taking TPT
The date on which the client began taking TPT
The date on which the client completed TPT
Screening algorithm selected for screening activities
Client screened for TB based on cough symptom
Client screened for TB based on any TB symptom
Client screened for TB based on the WHO-recommended four-symptom screen
Client screened for TB based on C-reactive protein (CRP) testing
Client screened for TB with a chest radiography (CXR)

element.short: Parallel screening algorithm with W4SS and CRP
element.definition: Client screened for TB using parallel screening with WHO-recommended four-symptom screen and C-reactive protein (CRP) testing

element.short: Sequential positive screening algorithm with W4SS and CRP
element.definition: Client screened for TB using sequential positive screening with WHO-recommended four-symptom screen and C-reactive protein (CRP) testing.

element.short: Sequential negative screening algorithm with W4SS and CRP
element.definition: Client screened for TB using sequential negative screening with WHO-recommended four-symptom screen and C-reactive protein (CRP) testing

element.short: Parallel screening algorithm with W4SS and CXR
element.definition: Client screened for TB using the parallel screening algorithm with W4SS and CXR

element.short: Sequential positive screening algorithm with W4SS and CXR
element.definition: Client screened for TB using sequential positive screening with WHO-recommended four-symptom screen and chest radiography

element.short: Sequential negative screening algorithm with W4SS and CXR
element.definition: Client screened for TB using sequential negative screening with WHO-recommended four-symptom screen and chest radiography
Client screened for TB with a molecular WHO-recommended rapid diagnostic test (mWRD), such as an Xpert MTB/RIF test to detect Mycobacterium tuberculosis (MTB)

Client screened for with a clinical evaluation for tuberculosis (TB) based on national guidelines. Clinical assessment may be used as an eligibility evaluation for testing with LF-LAM or for empiric TB treatment.
Client screened for tuberculosis (TB) with a different screening method not listed
Client screened for tuberculosis (TB) with a different screening method not listed (specify)
A screening for tuberculosis (TB) was performed
Symptoms that may indicate TB disease in clients living with HIV, based on a clinical algorithm
Client has a cough regardless of duration
Client has a prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more
Client has a fever with a measured temperature of 102.2 °F/39 °C or greater
Unexplained weight loss
Client reports experiencing night sweats
Client reports poor weight gain of child or infant or growth curve flattening or weight for age <-2 Z-scores.
Client reports reduced playfulness of child
Client reports chest pain
Client reports experiencing haemoptysis
Client reports lethargy
No symptoms of TB identified

element.short: History of contact with a person with TB
element.definition: Client had a history of a contact with a person with TB
Record the result of the tuberculosis (TB) screening
Screening result was positive for tuberculosis (TB)
Screening result was negative for tuberculosis (TB)
Screening result was inconclusive for tuberculosis (TB)
Date the TB screening was conducted
The date when the result of TB screening is available
The type of diagnostic test performed to detect tuberculosis (TB) disease
Client tested for tuberculosis with a lateral flow urine lipoarabinomannan assay
Client tested with a WHO-recommended molecular diagnostic test to detect Mycobacterium tuberculosis (MTB)
Client tested for tuberculosis with a sputum acid-fast bacilli (AFB)
Client tested for tuberculosis (TB) with a culture
The date when TB diagnostic test was performed
The date when the test sample was collected from the client
The date when the result of the TB diagnostic test is available
Indicates if TB treatment was started
The date on which the client start or restarted tuberculosis (TB) treatment
Indicates patients TB treatment outcome

The treatment regimen terminated or permanently changed to a new regimen or treatment strategy. Reasons for the change include:
- no clinical response or no bacteriological response, or both (see note;
- adverse drug reaction; or
- evidence of additional drug-resistance to medicines in the regimen.

Client with pulmonary TB with bacteriologically confirmed TB at the beginning of treatment who completed treatment as recommended by the national policy, with evidence of bacteriological response and no evidence of failure.
Patient completed treatment as recommended by the national policy but the outcome does not meet the definition for cure or treatment failure
Client died before starting treatment or during the course of treatment
Client was lost to follow-up
No treatment outcome was assigned. This includes cases transferred out' to another treatment unit and whose treatment outcome is unknown; however, it excludes those lost to follow-up.
Date client completes TB treatment
TB drugs currently being taken by the client
Client is currently taking isoniazid
Client is currently taking rifampicin
Client is currently taking rifabutin
Client is currently taking ethambutol
Client is currently taking levofloxacin
Client is currently taking pyrazinamide, a first-line anti-tuberculosis drug
Client is eligible for tuberculosis preventive treatment (TPT)

element.short: Date when eligibility for TB preventive treatment (TPT) was determined
element.definition: Date when a determination of the clients eligibility for TPT was made
Clients tuberculosis (TB) status when antiretroviral therapy (ART) is started
Signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) without laboratory confirmation
Laboratory confirmed tuberculosis (TB) diagnosis
Client has no signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) and is not diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB)
Indicates if the client accepts to be evaluated for TB infection and to take the treatment in case he/she is eligible
Type of extrapulmonary TB identified for the client is TB meningitis
The date on which the client has a test for C reactive protein
Test result of the clients C reactive protein test result in mg/L

element.short: C reactive protein test result date
element.definition: The date when the clients test result for C reactive protein is available
Type of TPT regimen the client is currently on
The clients current TPT regimen is 3HP
The clients current TPT regimen is 1HP
The clients current TPT regimen is 6H
The clients current TPT regimen is six months of levofloxacin daily
The clients current TPT regimen is another regimen than those listed above
Indicates the current status of TB preventive treatment (TPT)
The client did not start the TB preventive treatment (TPT)
The client started the TB preventive treatment (TPT) and is currently taking the medication, without treatment interruptions
The client started the TB preventive treatment (TPT) and is currently taking the medication, with treatment interruptions
The health care worker has temporarily stopped the TB preventive treatment (TPT), but TPT is expected to continue again later. May also be called "suspended".
TB preventive treatment (TPT) was completed
